D70 offers Substitute Teacher training - Virtual training offered to substitute teachers.
As we prepare to begin a new school year, District 70 will provide a virtual training for all substitute teachers hosted by District 70 nursing staff. This presentation will give you guidance on how to protect yourself and your students while subbing in district #70. The training will be offered at three different times to accommodate schedules. You only need to participate in one training. The training will be held utilizing ZOOM. You will need to log in to the Zoom link for the training you wish to attend. The presenter will take attendance and submit a participation list to the Department of Personnel Services. You will receive pay for the one hour of training that you attend.
http://edne.tw/n656524

D70 High School Graduation information.

We know it’s not the type of ceremony that our Seniors deserve, and not the type of ceremony that parents wanted, but we have worked diligently to plan and prepare a ceremony that meets local and state health restrictions while still celebrating our amazing Class of 2020.

It’s important to note that we sent out a survey to gather interest in four different scenarios, but shortly after that survey was completed, State Health Department and the Governor's Office changed their guidelines for public gatherings and we were forced to rework our plans. We even went as far as to submit a special variance through Pueblo County Commissioners.

We understand your frustration and angst over the situation. Seniors will be able to take their walk across their high school graduation stage and receive their diploma in front of 4 guests of their choice. The Ceremonies will all be recorded and Rye, PWHS, and PCHS will also have Live-Streaming of the ceremony. Schools will be sending out more information soon.

As always, thanks for your support.

Dear parents and guardians, we are in the process of providing all District 70 preschool staff with professional development in the Colorado Shines process. Colorado Shines is a new licensing process managed by the Colorado Department of Human Services, the Colorado State licensing department for preschools. Because of the need to have a concentrated day to familiarize the preschool staff with the details of Colorado Shines we find it necessary to cancel school for all preschool children on Monday, Jan. 4, 2016. All other grade levels will attend school on Monday, Jan. 4, 2016. ONLY PRESCHOOL WILL BE CANCELLED ON MONDAY, JAN. 4, 2016. School will resume for preschool on Tuesday, Jan. 5, 2016.

I encourage you to visit the Colorado Shines website, www.coloradoshines.com for information regarding this new process in the licensing of preschools.
If you have questions please contact your preschool child’s teacher.
Thank you for your cooperation in this necessary professional development for our preschool staff.

It's an exciting and proud time to be a LPI Panther!

The Colorado Department of Education picks several schools each year to visit, and this year they have chosen to recognize Liberty Point International School for the progress we have achieved, as well as our recent accreditation as an IB World School!

A formal assembly will be held at LPI on October 29, in which the CDE Commissioner will meet with teachers and students to acknowledge and commend our achievements and hard work. Potential guests who may accompany the Commissioner include our Governor, US Senators, US Members of Congress, CDE Personnel, County Commissioners, School Board Members, PW Metro District Members, and our Superintendent.

Multiple media will be present, including newspapers and television news crews. This is a monumental event for our school and our district! Great job, Panthers!
